abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of this project is
            rated as satisfactory. A key lesson from this project is
            that investments in petroleum development need to adequately
            account for the uncertainties of hydrocarbon reserves, and
            possible variations in production levels. Wherever possible,
            operator's reservoir estimates should be re-confirmed
            through independent studies, and field-tested technology
            should be adopted on future projects. It is also important
            that the targets/schedules for field development provide
            adequate time for completion of individual components. The
            project experience also highlights the need for establishing
            clear linkages between field development and investments in
            down-stream facilities. Another major lesson is the lack of
            familiarity with Bank procurement guidelines. Finally,
            long-term institutional measures need to be taken by the
            government for the development and facilitation of
            construction industry, especially pipeline construction, so
            that competent and qualified contracting firms are available
            in the country to undertake similar projects in the future.
